intro: Diascia lilacina, commonly known as the purple snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant purple to lilac-colored flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features trailing stems that make it suitable for container gardening. Its flowers are tubular and bilaterally symmetrical, with two lips that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Diascia lilacina is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders.
